snippet: A bipartisan task force said future contributions were likely to consume much of the revenue now dedicated to education and infrastructure.
abstract: New Jersey's Budget Crisis Task Force reports that Gov Chris Christie's pension overhaul plan has slowed but not stopped runaway growth in the cost of the state's promises to retired public workers; warns that officials of both parties had shortchanged the pension coffers for so long that it will likely be necessary to divert money away from other essential state programs in order to catch up.
lead_paragraph: A bipartisan task force said future contributions were likely to consume much of the revenue now dedicated to education and infrastructure.

headline.seo: Despite Overhaul, New Jersey Pension Plan Is Said to Be in Deep Trouble
headline.main: New Jersey’s Pension Plan Is Said to Be in Trouble Despite Overhaul by Christie
headline.print_headline: New Jersey’s Pension Plan Is Said to Still Be in Trouble
